founding_conditions.capital: Access to up to $15M via venture/angel capital if the opportunity is clean. $8-10M readily accessible; up to $15M for compelling physical/production plays. VC/angel appetite confirmed shifting toward hard-tech/robotics/physical-economy (a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials).
founding_conditions.team: 2 founders -- ML/AI Masters (Georgia Tech) + operator (Argentina native, US resident)
founding_conditions.location: Davis CA -- 1hr from SF, direct access to UC Davis ag robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crop growers
founding_conditions.markets: US + LATAM lowest friction, any geography viable on economics

history.reason: v2 reset -- balanced weights, no penalty premiums
First v2 cycle -- maintained balanced weights
Expanded scope cycle -- maintained balanced weights. Physical production signals naturally score well on structural_force_magnitude and barrier_complexity dimensions.

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance all releasing stored above-CPI energy simultaneously
Demographic Gap + AI Readiness Convergence: Nursing, insurance, accounting, trades, AND manufacturing aging workforce meets AI capability maturation
running_patterns.cycle_2_update: Expanded to include manufacturing demographic gap. Silver Tsunami (2.34M businesses, $10T transfer) is the demographic force for physical production.

running_patterns.description: Regulatory Fragmentation as Structural Moat: 47+ states + EU + NAIC + HIPAA + sector-specific creating compliance maze that rewards first navigators
running_patterns.cycle_2_update: Strengthened. CMS WISeR model adds federal-level AI endorsement. HIPAA Security Rule update deepens healthcare moat. NAIC model law creates insurance AI moat. Colorado AI Act June 2026. Regulatory moat now the STRONGEST pattern across services.

running_patterns.description: PE Distress + AI Cost Collapse Double Disruption: Refinancing wall + AI margin compression creating 12-24 month asset acquisition window
running_patterns.cycle_2_update: Distress rate reached 11.98% (+148% since 2022). PE portfolio companies 30% of bankruptcy filings. Pattern now applies to BOTH services and manufacturing -- broadens the acquisition universe.

running_patterns.description: Jevons Expansion 3-5x in Professional Services: Unserved market consistently 3-5x current served market across accounting, legal, finance, education
NEW: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression -- COGS reduction (not just SGA) in custom manufacturing, food, agriculture
running_patterns.detail: 9 independent signals confirm robotics x AI compound is compressing production costs. IFR installations doubling, cobots at $25-60K with 8-14mo ROI, PMI output-employment divergence, 98% manufacturers exploring. This is the second Baumol cure vector -- touching COGS through physical production, not just SGA through cognitive services.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Capital Allocation Rotation to Hard-Tech/Physical Economy -- VC/PE/asset managers shifting from pure-digital to physical production
running_patterns.detail: a16z $1.18B American Dynamism. VC robotics funding $6B+ in H1 2025 (tracking 263% growth). BlackRock overweight industrials. JPM AI supercycle broadening to healthcare, logistics, banking. Goldman above-consensus on US growth. Physical/production AI plays are now fundable at the $5-15M range.

running_patterns.description: NEW: SBA 504 + Equipment Financing = Physical Production Capital Structure Advantage unavailable to digital businesses
running_patterns.detail: SBA 504 loans up to $5.5M with ALL fees waived for manufacturers through FY2026. MARC revolving credit program. Equipment financing at 80-100% LTV. USDA VAPG up to $200K for value-added food. These structures create a capital advantage for physical production plays that pure-digital businesses cannot access. TIME-SENSITIVE: fee waiver expires Sept 30, 2026.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Christensen Sustaining vs Disruptive Distinction -- tool-layer competitors (Harvey, Puzzle, Waystar) are sustaining innovation for incumbents, not serving unserved markets
running_patterns.detail: Across accounting (Puzzle/Zeni), legal (Harvey $8B), and healthcare (Waystar $1.25B Iodine), the pattern is identical: well-funded competitors are building TOOLS for incumbents (sustaining innovation). None are building AI-FIRST SERVICES for underserved markets (disruptive innovation). The three-layer framework (tool/service/full-service) reveals sparse service layers across all top opportunities.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Silver Tsunami Acquisition Window -- 2.34M boomer businesses, $10T transfer, 58% with no succession plan = 5-10 year acquisition window
running_patterns.detail: The largest ownership transfer in US history. Manufacturing subset is particularly valuable: good IP, customer contracts, equipment, and licenses but outdated cost structures. Retirement sales at 2-4x EBITDA vs 8-12x healthy. PE is already exploiting this but focused on roll-ups (Minsky vulnerable). Robotics x AI modernization is the alternative thesis.

barriers_noted.status: Commoditizing (OpenAI, Hathr.ai) -- moat shifting to EHR integration
Sustaining innovation only -- SMB service layer remains sparse
NEW -- few can do it well, creates service moat
NEW -- running production is hard, creates moat
Build at service layer to avoid

agent_a.cycle_2_note: Expanded to 8 source categories. 12 signals from new manufacturing/robotics category. 3 counter-signals produced for top opportunities.

agent_b.cycle_2_note: First physical production models (Type 6) constructed. V3b verification applied to manufacturing and food production. SBA 504 capital structures modeled.

Cobot integration partners who can modernize acquired manufacturers in 3-6 months
UC Davis AIFS program: can founders access as non-students? Partnership structure?
USDA VAPG application competitiveness and approval rate for AI-enabled food production
Competitive density in SMB accounting AI SERVICE layer (not tool layer)
HIPAA compliance actual cost with new commodity platforms (OpenAI for Healthcare, Hathr.ai)
CMS WISeR model: which technology companies were selected? Can startups participate?
CPA licensing acquisition cost for small practices in California (post-AB 1175)
LATAM insurance market: which countries have friendliest regulatory environment for AI claims?
State-by-state insurance TPA licensing requirements for AI claims processors
Customer acquisition cost for AI professional services targeting SMBs
Manufacturing AI integration service pricing: what are SME manufacturers willing to pay?
Specialty food/beverage producers in Davis CA area: market scan needed
SBA MARC revolving credit program: terms and availability for startups
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Screen BizBuySell/LoopNet for 10-20 specific manufacturing/food businesses for sale in CA/West Coast. Get real acquisition prices and terms.
PRIORITY 2: Deep-dive unit economics on top 3 physical production plays (custom manufacturing, specialty food, precision ag) with actual equipment costs and SBA 504 modeling.
PRIORITY 3: Competitive density analysis at SERVICE LAYER (not tool layer) for accounting, healthcare, insurance, legal. How many companies actually DO the work vs sell tools?
PRIORITY 4: Interview 5-10 potential customers across top opportunities (retiring manufacturer owners, independent physician practices, SMBs without CPAs).
PRIORITY 5: CMS WISeR model deep-dive -- which technology companies are participating? What's the entry path for a startup?
PRIORITY 6: UC Davis AIFS partnership exploration -- what collaboration structures exist for Davis-based AI companies?
PRIORITY 7: Model the SBA 504 + equipment financing + USDA VAPG capital stack for a specific $5-8M manufacturing acquisition scenario.
PRIORITY 8: LATAM deep-dive -- which specific LATAM markets have weakest incumbents in insurance claims AND manufacturing integration?
